title.narrative: CHANGING SOCIAL NORMS

description.narrative: By 2022, social sector institutions will have strengthened their capacities to efficiently and innovatively design, manage, monitor and evaluate public policies in areas linked to the Cooperation Program., which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable and excluded children and adolescents live in violence-free environments and benefit from effective, innovative and non-discriminatory policies and programmes that guarantee equality of opportunities for their integral protection.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, social sector institutions will have strengthened their capacities to efficiently and innovatively design, manage, monitorand evaluate public policies in areas linked to the Cooperation Program.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF worked towards changing societal knowledge, perceptions, attitudes and behavior with regard to three prioritized intervention areas: a) modification of violent parenting patterns in Indigenous communities in Talamanca; b) hegemonic masculinity where men’s wills are imposed on women, generating violence and inequalities; and c) xenophobia against migrant children, adolescents, and young people. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of institutions that incorporate in their Annual Operation Plans strategies to promote CAP against violence.(57841)

baseline.value: Baseline to be developed from the analysis of the Annual Operating Plans from the institutions that that make up the CNNA

title.narrative: Developed a strategy towards the reduction of violent attitudes, practices and social norms (CAP) in priority areas(57840), Text

baseline.value: No comprehensive C4D strategy has been implemented.

target.value: 2022:At least 3 C4D strategy aimed at changing violent social norms has been fully implemented
